page.title: 10 RAF ABINGDON(FIRE STATION)
page.content: The man interviewed,was called Corporal Webb.The FIRE STATION was established in 1932.They have four fire fighting VEHICLES,but 2 of them are spares for other stations.The types they have are a"Gloster Saro";Range Rover;a Mark 9 foam vehicle;Fawley and Croft"Mark 10 Scammel"and a"Tac R 1 Leyland" A new fully equipped Range Rover would cost about 30,000 pounds.Two types of extinguishing MEDIA are used, these are:flrour protein foam and aqueas film forming foam.on average there are 2 FIRES a year on the camp, there has been 1 aircraft engine fire in the last 3 years.The crew practice at least once a month,this is on an old Canberra bomber. Iain kershaw,Nicholas Lardner& Mark Summers.
